definition: to foster/to provide care (esp. for the elderly)
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Another worker slit his wrist and was hospitalized.
sentences.chinese: 另一名員工試圖割腕自殺，現在醫院安養。

sentences.english: At age 94, Pastor Willis was admitted into a care facility.
sentences.chinese: 威利牧師在94歲那年進入安養院。

sentences.english: Therapy dogs, so often associated with nursing homes, have expanded their range.
sentences.chinese: 常與安養中心聯在一起的治療犬，已擴張它們的地盤。

definition: golden years (after the age of about 60)
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
unable to move freely/difficult to get about
variant of 原來|原来[yuan2 lai2]
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
